qas.question: According to the Vatican who could the healing of an unborn child be attributed to in the 1990's?
Who approved the miracle of Paul VI?
What group was responsible for recognizing Paul Vi's miracle?

answers.text: Congregation for the Causes of Saints

qas.question: What is the process called that acknowledges sainthood?

context: In December 2013, Vatican officials approved a supposed miracle that was attributed to the intercession of the late <a0_0>pontiff<a0_0/> which was the curing of an unborn child in California, U.S.A in the 1990s. It was expected that <a1_0>Pope Francis<a1_0/> would approve the miracle in the near future, thus, warranting the <a3_0>beatification<a3_0/> of the late pontiff. In February 2014, it was reported that the consulting Vatican theologians to the <a2_0>Congregation for the Causes of Saints<a2_0/> recognized the miracle attributed to the late pontiff.
